gurmukhi: Agin jrq jl bUfq srp gRsih ssqR Anyk rom rom kir Gwq hY
transliteration: Agani Jarat Jal Boodat Sarap Grasahi , Sasatr Anayk Rom Rom Kari Ghaat Hai ?
translation: Pain in the body due to burns, drowning in water, snakebite or wounds received by the strike of weapons;

gurmukhi: ibrQw Anyk Apdw ADIn dIn giq gRIKm AO sIq brK mwih ins pRwq hY
transliteration: Biradaa Anayk Apadaa Adheen Deen Gati , Greekham Au Seet Barakh Maahi Nis Praat Hai ?
translation: Sufferings of many distresses, spending days in summer, winter and even rainy seasons and bearing these discomforts;

gurmukhi: go idÍj bDU ibsÍws bMs koit hqXw qiRsnw Anyk duK doK bs gwq hY
transliteration: Go Dvij Badhoo Bisvaas Bans Koti Hatayaa , Trisanaa Anayk Doukh Dokh Bas Gaat Hai ?
translation: Distresses of the body due to killing of a cow, brahmin, a woman, trust, family and many such-like sins and stigmas performed under the influence of desires.

gurmukhi: Aink pRkwr jor skl sMswr soD pIX ky ibCoh pl eyk n pujwq hY ]572]
transliteration: Anik Prakaar Jor Sakal Sansaar Sodha , Peey Kay Bichhoh Pal Ayk N Pujaat Hai ?572?
translation: All the pains of the world put together cannot reach the pain of separation of the Lord even for a moment. (All worldly distresses are trivial compared to the pangs of separation of the Lord).   (572)
